title: A few things about Jhin
body:
So basically now that his out and we are getting a proper look at Jhin, i wanted to give my personal thoughts.

So first off, he is not strong, in fact he is rather weak as an ADC in general and i will explain why.

So the first point to cover, is the immobility, he is one of those immobile ADC's like Ashe, Twitch, Varus, Kog'maw and Urgot, now a lot of people will ask why i bring this up, and it's simply because mobility is something that is actually rather useful as an ADC, sure these 4 are playable, but if you fuck up even the slightest, you're pretty screwed.

But this Immobile ADC brings something different to the immobile ADC list, and that is Burst, which is something most ADC's aren't known for.

But the problem with this is, is just how gold reliant he is to even get decently going, due to the nature of his passive, you are actually forced into a rather awkward position in that you HAVE to build AD as a first item, because if you build something like RFC, well you have no AD for that crit strike/Attack Speed to scale off.

So Jhin has his first powerspike where most ADC's used to have it, and that is at an IE(/ER but i think most people will go IE first), the problem of course being, that this isn't actually the meta anymore, and most champions are having harder spikes earlier on whereas Jhin only really has this spike at the item completion (the other power spikes for other champs are Ez/Corki spiking at Sheen, Lucian/MF/Graves spiking at Warhammer)

What this does is force you to the point where your main power spike is 3.6k gold away, and it's not going to be easy because of that passive either, if your team is able to set you up kills it will be alright, but before 6, if you get a kill it's mostly due to jungle/support over yourself doing all that much (there is no real way for Jhin to net himself an early kill against an ADC unless they let you hit them with every 4th shot but lets ignore that)

Add to this his rather mediocre range of 550 (very few of the meta champions are lower than this, and they have lower range's due to actual mobility) and you're not going to have all that fun of a time getting to that first power spike.

So Jhin is basically like a Kog'maw in that sense in that he has to farm up for items before he can do all that much, and then we run into the problem of what this meta is filled with, and that is 20-30 minute games, where Jhin thrives on the 35+ minute mark where he is finishing his 3rd-5th items and has like 1k AD, sure if you can somehow manage to delay all your games till your fed, you will be able to do a decent amount, it's just hard to get to that point.

Overall i think Jhin though he can feel powerful, this is only when your ahead, and realistically he has very few tools to get ahead, outside of Jungler/Support doing the majority of the work, and in practice he tends to be very underwhelming when there are champs that do the burst thing better (graves) and can do it with their own play rather than relying on others.

replies.body: His range makes up for some of the immobility surely?

His range is actually fairly shit (550 is mediocre at best, and considering no person want's to take your 4th shot, you won't get much damage out on anything the same range.), and you can't rush an RFC as you need AD for the RFC to scale off.

I think he meant the range with the W (? the long range one that roots if they've taken damage) and his ult.

I'd say he's got a decent point, Jhin still has incredible teamfight potential for an ADC even if he's behind (well unless the rest of your team is real behind as well but that;s a whole other issue)

While his W is alright, it's basically reliant on other CC to hit or else you're relying on your opponent being slightly brain dead, as the hit box is tiny.

As for the ult, you're still at a point where for that ult to do damage, you need items, and on top of that, you need to be not interrupted, meaning you aren't in the teamfight to do anything but ult.

The ult still slows, which is valuable in fights, even if the damage is negligible, and if you're smart with your traps then the W is quite easy to hit as far as I've seen, it is a pretty speedy projectile. But there will always be champs that don't play well from behind, and I think he's going to be one of them. I don't know enough about him yet to from any concrete opinions.

The thing is, a lot of champs that don't play well from behind, have some way to get ahead, Jhin lacks this a lot.

And having an ADC that is immobile that you have to get ahead on your team, is just a massive weight on your team in the end.
Hmm like I said, don't have enough experience to really say, I reckon we'll all have a much better idea of all this in a month or so.

honestly outside of his W/Ult his range is mediocre, and his W is his only disengage tool, and the ult is mostly like a Xerath R, which is mostly an execute.
honestly cant contribute much but to say that I was on the receiving end of his shots and he was well out of range of anyone except perhaps xerath.

This is just someone ive done, on multiple occasions, and they might patch it after but when you use jihns ult for the first time in a match you can actually shoot a bit out of the range that is shown, ive done it on 3 different occasions

I haven't played him yet, and haven't played too many games with him so my experience is limited, but my basic understand is that he is very strong BUT also more reliant on the duo lane mechanic than most ADCs. Most other ADCs have decent kill potential on their own, whereas in the early Jhin seems to need to rely on at least some CC from the support. 

That said I don't think he's weak at all, in fact I think the opposite, but he's the most removed from the typical ADC playstyle so far as I can tell, so people are still very much getting used to him, and even ADC mains will have to switch things up a bit. My feeling is that if you have even a halfway decent support and you watch and follow their engages/pokes then you should do pretty well as Jhin (in an even skill level match up at any rate).

That's just my experience, and it's not exactly qualified evidence, just what I've been seeing. I played an abysmal support game and the Jhin did bad too, I played a great support game and the Jhin did great too. It's not so easy with people being individuals and all, but so far that theory has held true for me in 10~ or so games.
